name: Abyssal Chicken

trait.name: Bad Flier
text: The abyssal chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The abyssal chicken makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

description:
Abyssal chickens are carnivorous, temperamental, tasty bottom-feeders native to the Abyss. They beat their leathery wings to scare predators and to help them run faster, and they taste like fatty chicken.
With your permission, a character who casts the find familiar spell can henceforth choose to conjure an abyssal chicken instead of a raven.
Source: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 97
